subject: Re: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.

messageBody:
Hi Sivaprasad,

you will need to use java reflection if you want to test private methods. I
wrote a class for the project I am currently working on called
SecureClassAcess.java which takes the work out of doing this. It will allow
you to test private methods and fields. Also, remember that if your method
throws an Exception that you can use the getCause() to retrieve the original
exception and get the class name and assert that it was the correct
Exception thrown.

I don't mind anyone using it or changing it for the better. It is well
documented with examples on how to use it. I recommend that you look at the
code to see how it is done. Let me know if you didn't get the attachment as
I can send it to you directly.

A+
David
